item.title: 中国工厂产出和零售额增速为一年多来最差
item.description: 10月份，中国的工厂产出和零售额增速为一年多来最弱，这给决策者带来了压力，要求他们重整这个19万亿美元的出口导向型经济体，因为日益加剧的供需紧张有可能进一步抑制经济增长。【原文：China's factory output and retail sales grew at their weakest pace in over a year in October, piling pressure on policymakers to revamp the $19 trillion export-driven economy as mounting supply and demand strains threaten to further curtail growth.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：亚马逊和微软支持限制英伟达对华出口的努力
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，亚马逊正与微软一道支持立法，进一步限制芯片制造商英伟达（Nvidia）向中国出口的能力。【原文：Amazon is joining Microsoft in backing legislation to further limit chipmaker Nvidia's ability to export to China, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司首席执行官称波音 777-9 延误不会造成重大影响
item.description: 新加坡航空公司首席执行官吴俊峰（Goh Choon Phong）周五表示，新加坡航空公司预计波音777-9飞机延迟交付不会造成重大影响。【原文：Singapore Airlines is not expecting a major impact from the delay in delivery of Boeing 777-9 planes, CEO Goh Choon Phong said on Friday.】

item.title: 李明博：韩美就贸易、安全协议和核潜艇达成一致
item.description: 韩国总统李在明周五表示，在上个月与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）举行峰会后，韩美两国已就贸易和安全问题的协议敲定了一份联合概况介绍。【原文：South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said on Friday South Korea and U.S. had finalised a joint fact sheet on agreements on trade and security issues after his summit with U.S. President Donald Trump last month.】

item.title: 韩国将于 2026 年提高电动汽车补贴，帮助汽车行业抵御美国关税影响
item.description: 韩国政府周五表示，明年将把对电动汽车（EV）的补贴提高20%，作为帮助韩国汽车业抵御美国关税风险的一揽子计划的一部分。【原文：South Korea's government said on Friday it would boost subsidies for electric vehicles (EVs) by 20% next year as part of a package to help the country's auto industry weather risks caused by U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 美国与阿根廷、厄瓜多尔、萨尔瓦多和危地马拉的框架贸易协议要点
item.description: 美国周四宣布与阿根廷、厄瓜多尔、萨尔瓦多和危地马拉达成框架协议，华盛顿将降低对部分食品和其他商品的进口关税，同时这些国家将向更多美国农产品和工业品开放市场。【原文：The United States on Thursday announced framework agreements with Argentina, Ecuador, El Salvador and Guatemala that will see Washington drop tariffs on imports of some foods and other goods, while those countries will open their markets to more U.S. agricultural and industrial goods.】

item.title: 美国银行和纽约梅隆银行寻求终结爱泼斯坦诉讼案
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）和纽约梅隆银行（Bank of New York Mellon）周四请求联邦法官驳回指控它们在知情的情况下帮助杰弗里-爱泼斯坦（Jeffrey Epstein）进行性交易的诉讼，因为它们向这位声名狼藉的已故金融家提供了银行服务。【原文：Bank of America and Bank of New York Mellon asked a federal judge on Thursday to dismiss lawsuits accusing them of knowingly aiding Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking by providing banking services to the disgraced late financier.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚国家石油公司（Ecopetrol）将在 2025 年实施 63 亿美元的投资，并再钻探五口油井
item.description: 哥伦比亚国营能源公司 Ecopetrol ECO.CN 的高管周四在接受路透社采访时表示，预计 2025 年将完成约 63 亿美元的投资，相当于目标的 90%。【原文：Colombia's state-run energy company Ecopetrol ECO.CN expects to execute about $6.3 billion in investments in 2025, equivalent to 90% of its target, executives from the company told Reuters in an interview on Thursday, adding it could close the year with five additional exploratory wells drilled.】

item.title: 美元因担心美国数据大雾可能带来的影响而下滑
item.description: 由于投资者在等待政府重新开放后积压的美国数据，他们预计这些数据可能会表明经济疲软，因此美元在周五奋力收复大幅失地，并有望连续一周下跌。【原文：The dollar struggled to claw back steep losses on Friday and was on track for a weekly fall, as investors awaited a backlog of U.S. data following the government's reopening, which they expect will likely point to a weakening economy.】

item.title: 美联储即将降息的希望破灭，股市下跌
item.description: 由于美联储官员的鹰派言论浇灭了美国下月降息的希望，亚洲股市周五加入了全球股市大跌的行列。【原文：Asian shares joined a global selloff on Friday as hawkish comments from Federal Reserve officials doused hopes for a U.S. rate cut next month, while a still messy data calendar added to the angst, hitting bonds, the dollar and even gold.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，默克公司接近达成 Cidara 交易
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，默克公司即将达成收购 Cidara Therapeutics 公司的交易，该交易对这家生物技术公司的估值较其 33 亿美元的市值有一定溢价。【原文：Merck is closing in on a deal to buy Cidara Therapeutics in a deal valuing the biotechnology company at a premium to its $3.3 billion market capitalization, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 哈弗分析公司预计美国每周申请失业救济人数下降
item.description: 据哈弗分析公司（Haver Analytics）周四估计，上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数略有减少，这表明劳动力市场状况稳定，可能为美联储下月维持利率不变提供掩护。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits eased slightly last week, Haver Analytics estimated on Thursday, pointing to stable labor market conditions that could provide the Federal Reserve cover to keep interest rates unchanged next month.】

item.title: 美国将取消对厄瓜多尔、阿根廷、危地马拉和萨尔瓦多部分产品的关税
item.description: 美国周四表示，根据框架协议，美国将取消对从阿根廷、厄瓜多尔、危地马拉和萨尔瓦多进口的部分食品和其他商品征收的关税，这将为美国企业进入这些市场提供更多机会。【原文：The United States said on Thursday it will remove tariffs on some foods and other imports from Argentina, Ecuador, Guatemala and El Salvador under framework agreements that will give U.S. firms greater access to those markets.】

item.title: 力拓与美国 TerraGen 公司签订为期 15 年的可再生能源协议
item.description: 力拓集团周五表示，其位于美国犹他州的肯尼科特公司已与 TerraGen 公司签署了一份为期 15 年的虚拟购电协议，从德克萨斯州的一个新风场获取可再生能源。【原文：Rio Tinto said on Friday its Kennecott operation in Utah, U.S., has signed a 15-year virtual power purchase agreement with TerraGen to source renewable energy from a new wind farm in Texas.】

item.title: 澳大利亚人工智能公司 Firmus 拟融资 3.25 亿美元，以加速人工智能基础设施的推广
item.description: 澳大利亚的 Firmus 公司周五宣布筹集 5 亿澳元（约合 3.249 亿美元）的资金，这家人工智能公司和潜在的 IPO 候选公司希望加快其人工智能基础设施计划--南门项目的发展。【原文：Australia's Firmus announced on Friday an equity raise of A$500 million ($324.90 million) as the artificial intelligence company and potential IPO candidate looks to accelerate development of Project Southgate, its AI infrastructure initiative.】

item.title: 辉瑞前研发主管多尔斯滕退出诺和诺德董事会竞选
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）周四表示，辉瑞公司前研发主管 Mikael Dolsten 因个人原因退出了诺和诺德董事会的竞选。【原文：Mikael Dolsten, Pfizer's former research and development chief, has withdrawn his candidacy for Novo Nordisk's board, citing personal reasons, the Danish drugmaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利就紫金矿业在港首次公开募股接受美国众议院小组质询
item.description: 美国众议院一个委员会周四向摩根士丹利表示，摩根士丹利承销紫金黄金国际有限公司（Zijin Gold International）在香港的首次公开募股，使该公司及其美国投资者面临监管、财务和声誉受损的风险。【原文：Morgan Stanley's underwriting of Zijin Gold International's Hong Kong IPO placed it and its U.S. investors at risk of regulatory, financial and reputational harm, a U.S. House of Representatives committee told the bank on Thursday.】

item.title: 空难遇难者家属对美国法官驳回波音公司刑事案件的决定提出上诉
item.description: 两架波音 737 MAX 客机坠毁，造成 346 人死亡，部分遇难者家属周四要求美国上诉法院推翻法官的裁决，即批准司法部关于撤销针对该飞机制造商的刑事案件的请求。【原文：Families of some victims of two Boeing 737 MAX plane crashes that killed 346 people asked a U.S. appeals court on Thursday to reverse a judge's decision to approve the Justice Department's request to dismiss a criminal case against the planemaker.】

item.title: Under Armour 扩大重组力度，计划分离库里业务
item.description: Under Armour 周四表示，计划分离旗下的 Curry 品牌，此前这家运动服制造商的董事会又批准了 9500 万美元的重组计划。【原文：Under Armour said on Thursday it plans to separate its Curry Brand, after the sportswear maker's board approved another $95 million in restructuring efforts.】

item.title: 美国市场环境依然严峻，JBS 利润下降
item.description: 全球最大的肉类公司 JBS 周四发布的财报显示，尽管全球净销售额有所增长，但美国牛肉市场环境依然严峻，该公司第三季度净利润出现下滑。【原文：JBS , the world's largest meat company, reported a net profit fall in the third quarter in spite of a rise in global net sales amid a still-challenging beef market environment in the U.S., according to an earnings statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 尽管美国联邦航空局下达了 6% 的命令，但美国航空公司仍减少了周五的航班削减量
item.description: 据航空分析公司 Cirium 和航空公司官员称，尽管在美国 40 个最繁忙的机场削减 6% 的国内航班的要求没有改变，但美国航空公司周五削减的航班数量却少得多。【原文：U.S. airlines have cut far fewer flights for Friday despite no change in a requirement that they cut 6% of domestic flights at the 40 busiest American airports, according to aviation analytics firm Cirium and airline officials.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定，苹果和 OpenAI 目前必须面对 X 公司的诉讼
item.description: 苹果公司和 ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 周四未能说服联邦法官驳回埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司指控它们合谋垄断智能手机和人工智能聊天机器人市场的诉讼。【原文：Apple and ChatGPT maker OpenAI on Thursday failed to convince a federal judge to dismiss a lawsuit by Elon Musk’s X Corp accusing them of conspiring to monopolize markets for smartphones and generative AI chatbots.】

item.title: 辉瑞削减 COVID 疫苗合作伙伴 BioNTech 的股份
item.description: 辉瑞公司（Pfizer Inc）周四表示，在两家公司结成联盟并生产出抗击致命的 COVID-19 大流行病的疫苗五年多之后，辉瑞公司出售了其在德国制药商 BioNTech SE 的部分股份。【原文：Pfizer Inc said on Thursday that it sold a part of its stake in German drugmaker BioNTech SE , more than five years after both firms formed an alliance that yielded a vaccine to combat the deadly COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 交易日：美联储希望融化，股市下挫
item.description: 由于对美联储下月降息的预期迅速减弱，周四华尔街暴跌，国债收益率上升，美元也在美国资产价格惨淡的时段内下跌。【原文：Wall Street tumbled and Treasury yields rose on Thursday as expectations of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut next month faded rapidly, while the dollar also fell in a bleak session for U.S. asset prices.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟探索公司启动战略审查，包括出售公司
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）周四表示，针对多方主动提出的意向，公司已开始对战略替代方案进行审查。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery said on Thursday it had initiated a review of strategic alternatives in response to unsolicited interest from multiple parties.】

item.title: 标普数据显示，在信贷紧张的背景下，美国企业破产数量将创15年新高
item.description: S&P全球公司周四的数据显示，美国大型企业破产数量将创下15年来的最高水平，这凸显了美国企业在公开市场投资者的敏感时期面临着越来越大的压力。【原文：Large U.S. corporate bankruptcies are on pace to hit their highest level in 15 years, S&P Global data showed on Thursday, underscoring mounting stress across corporate America at a sensitive time for public market investors.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，米拉-穆拉提的 Thinking Machines 在融资谈判中寻求 500 亿美元的估值
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，由前 OpenAI 高管米拉-穆拉提（Mira Murati）创办的人工智能初创公司 Thinking Machines Lab 正在进行早期谈判，希望以约 500 亿美元的估值进行新一轮融资。【原文：Thinking Machines Lab, the artificial intelligence startup founded by former OpenAI executive Mira Murati, is in early talks to raise a new funding round at a roughly $50 billion valuation, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 数字贷款机构努比亚银行第三季度收入超预期，盈利能力创历史新高
item.description: 经营巴西数字贷款公司 Nubank 的上市实体 Nu Holdings 周四公布，在巴西和墨西哥业务的推动下，该公司第三季度净收入增长，超过了分析师的预期。【原文：Nu Holdings , the listed entity which runs Brazilian digital lender Nubank, posted on Thursday an increase in its third-quarter net income driven by its Brazilian and Mexican businesses, beating analysts' projections.】

item.title: 应用材料公司预测人工智能芯片需求将带来强劲的季度收入
item.description: 美国半导体制造设备制造商应用材料公司（Applied Materials）周四预测第一季度营收乐观，表明对用于制造人工智能芯片的工具的强劲需求将压倒整个行业的放缓。【原文：Applied Materials , U.S.-based maker of semiconductor manufacturing equipment, forecast upbeat first-quarter revenue on Thursday, signaling that robust demand for tools used to make AI chips is set to overpower a broader industry slowdown.】

item.title: 蓝色起源公司的新格伦火箭在美国国家航空航天局的首次任务中部署火星卫星
item.description: 亿万富翁杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）的蓝色起源太空公司（Blue Origin）周四从佛罗里达州发射了巨型 "新格伦"（New Glenn）火箭，这是该公司首次为付费客户进行的首次飞行，搭载了两颗前往火星的卫星，这是该公司首次执行美国国家航空航天局（NASA）规模的科学任务。【原文：The Blue Origin space venture of billionaire Jeff Bezos launched its giant New Glenn rocket from Florida on Thursday on its debut flight for paying customers, carrying two satellites on their way to Mars in the company's first NASA-scale science mission.】
